meanings.definition: The supply of nerves to a specific body part or organ.
meanings.sent1: The innervation of the hand allows us to feel and touch things.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the innervation of the brain to understand how it controls our movements.
meanings.sent3: The innervation of the stomach must be working hard after that big meal!
meanings.sent4: Her words had an innervation effect on his heart, making it race with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The innervation of the skin makes us aware of changes in temperature and pressure.

meanings.definition: The process of stimulating or supplying nerves to a muscle or body part.
meanings.sent1: Physical therapists use innervation techniques to help patients regain movement in their limbs.
meanings.sent2: During exercise, the innervation of muscles increases to support the body's movements.
meanings.sent3: The innervation of the leg muscles during a workout can sometimes feel like tiny electric shocks.
meanings.sent4: His music had an innervation effect on the crowd, making them dance uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: The innervation of the vocal cords is crucial for producing clear speech and singing.
